### createMaskInstrs() {#a44f4e9b64d7a612f2b8236f0d147f591}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static PartwordMaskValues createMaskInstrs (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase">IRBuilderBase</a> &amp; Builder, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; ValueType, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; Addr, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> AddrAlign, unsigned MinWordSize)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
This is a helper function which builds instructions to provide values necessary for partword atomic operations.

It takes an incoming address, Addr, and <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad18871060ac1b051c7322cc6ad71e11c">ValueType</a>, and constructs the address, shift-amounts and masks needed to work with a larger value of size WordSize.

AlignedAddr: Addr rounded down to a multiple of WordSize

ShiftAmt: Number of bits to right-shift a WordSize value loaded from AlignAddr for it to have the same value as if <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad18871060ac1b051c7322cc6ad71e11c">ValueType</a> was loaded from Addr.

Mask: <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> to mask with the value loaded from AlignAddr to include only the part that would&#39;ve been loaded from Addr.

Inv&#95;Mask: The inverse of Mask.

Definition at line <a href="#l00799">799</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/atomicexpandpass-cpp">AtomicExpandPass.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["static"]}>
Emit IR to implement a masked version of a given atomicrmw operation.

(That is, only the bits under the Mask should be affected by the operation)

<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Convert an atomic store of a non-integral type to an integer store of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><Highlight kind="comment">/// equivalent bitwidth.  We used to not support floating point or vector</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><Highlight kind="comment">/// atomics in the IR at all.  The backends learned to deal with the bitcast</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><Highlight kind="comment">/// idiom because that was the only way of expressing the notion of a atomic</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><Highlight kind="comment">/// float or vector store.  The long term plan is to teach each backend to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instruction select from the original atomic store, but as a migration</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><Highlight kind="comment">/// mechanism, we convert back to the old format which the backends understand.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Each backend will need individual work to recognize the new format.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="610"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AtomicExpandImpl::expandAtomicStore(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/storeinst">StoreInst</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="611"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This function is only called on atomic stores that are too large to be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="612"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// atomic if implemented as a native store. So we replace them by an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="613"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// atomic swap, that can be implemented for example as a ldrex/strex on ARM</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="614"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// or lock cmpxchg8/16b on X86, as these are atomic for larger sizes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="615"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It is the responsibility of the target to only signal expansion via</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="616"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// shouldExpandAtomicRMW in cases where this is required and possible.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="782"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="783"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This is a helper function which builds instructions to provide</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="784"><Highlight kind="comment">/// values necessary for partword atomic operations. It takes an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="785"><Highlight kind="comment">/// incoming address, Addr, and ValueType, and constructs the address,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="786"><Highlight kind="comment">/// shift-amounts and masks needed to work with a larger value of size</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="787"><Highlight kind="comment">/// WordSize.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="789"><Highlight kind="comment">/// AlignedAddr: Addr rounded down to a multiple of WordSize</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="790"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00791" /><CodeLine lineNumber="791"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ShiftAmt: Number of bits to right-shift a WordSize value loaded</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="792"><Highlight kind="comment">///           from AlignAddr for it to have the same value as if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="793"><Highlight kind="comment">///           ValueType was loaded from Addr.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="795"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Mask: Value to mask with the value loaded from AlignAddr to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="796"><Highlight kind="comment">///       include only the part that would&#39;ve been loaded from Addr.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Inv&#95;Mask: The inverse of Mask.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00894" /><CodeLine lineNumber="894"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Emit IR to implement a masked version of a given atomicrmw</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00895" /><CodeLine lineNumber="895"><Highlight kind="comment">/// operation. (That is, only the bits under the Mask should be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00896" /><CodeLine lineNumber="896"><Highlight kind="comment">/// affected by the operation)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1042"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AtomicExpandImpl::expandPartwordCmpXchg(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/atomiccmpxchginst">AtomicCmpXchgInst</a> &#42;CI) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1043"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The basic idea here is that we&#39;re expanding a cmpxchg of a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1044"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// smaller memory size up to a word-sized cmpxchg. To do this, we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1045"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// need to add a retry-loop for strong cmpxchg, so that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1046"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// modifications to other parts of the word don&#39;t cause a spurious</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1047"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// failure.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1048"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1049"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This generates code like the following:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1050"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     &#91;&#91;Setup mask values PMV.&#42;&#93;&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1051"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %NewVal&#95;Shifted = shl i32 %NewVal, %PMV.ShiftAmt</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1052"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %Cmp&#95;Shifted = shl i32 %Cmp, %PMV.ShiftAmt</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1053"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %InitLoaded = load i32&#42; %addr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1054"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %InitLoaded&#95;MaskOut = and i32 %InitLoaded, %PMV.Inv&#95;Mask</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1055"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     br partword.cmpxchg.loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1056"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// partword.cmpxchg.loop:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1057"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %Loaded&#95;MaskOut = phi i32 &#91; %InitLoaded&#95;MaskOut, %entry &#93;,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1058"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        &#91; %OldVal&#95;MaskOut, %partword.cmpxchg.failure &#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1059"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %FullWord&#95;NewVal = or i32 %Loaded&#95;MaskOut, %NewVal&#95;Shifted</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1060"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %FullWord&#95;Cmp = or i32 %Loaded&#95;MaskOut, %Cmp&#95;Shifted</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1061"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %NewCI = cmpxchg i32&#42; %PMV.AlignedAddr, i32 %FullWord&#95;Cmp,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1062"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        i32 %FullWord&#95;NewVal success&#95;ordering failure&#95;ordering</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1063"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %OldVal = extractvalue &#123; i32, i1 &#125; %NewCI, 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1064"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %Success = extractvalue &#123; i32, i1 &#125; %NewCI, 1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1065"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     br i1 %Success, label %partword.cmpxchg.end,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1066"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        label %partword.cmpxchg.failure</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1067"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// partword.cmpxchg.failure:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1068"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %OldVal&#95;MaskOut = and i32 %OldVal, %PMV.Inv&#95;Mask</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1073"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    %tmp1 = lshr i32 %OldVal, %PMV.ShiftAmt</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1246"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1252"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %stored = @store&#95;conditional(%new, %addr)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1253"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %try&#95;again = icmp i32 ne %stored, 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1254"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     br i1 %try&#95;again, label %loop, label %atomicrmw.end</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1255"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// atomicrmw.end:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1256"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     &#91;...&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1283"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Convert an atomic cmpxchg of a non-integral type to an integer cmpxchg of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1284"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the equivalent bitwidth.  We used to not support pointer cmpxchg in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1285"><Highlight kind="comment">/// IR.  As a migration step, we convert back to what use to be the standard</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1286"><Highlight kind="comment">/// way to represent a pointer cmpxchg so that we can update backends one by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1287"><Highlight kind="comment">/// one.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1288"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/atomiccmpxchginst">AtomicCmpXchgInst</a> &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1329"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If shouldInsertFencesForAtomic() returns true, then the target does not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1330"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// want to deal with memory orders, and emitLeading/TrailingFence should take</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1331"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// care of everything. Otherwise, emitLeading/TrailingFence are no-op and we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1332"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// should preserve the ordering.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1333"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ShouldInsertFencesForAtomic = TLI-&gt;shouldInsertFencesForAtomic(CI);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1334"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7">AtomicOrdering</a> MemOpOrder = ShouldInsertFencesForAtomic</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1335"><Highlight kind="normal">                                  ? <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7a14194d0b2e6c6680067975517cd58eac">AtomicOrdering::Monotonic</a></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1336"><Highlight kind="normal">                                  : CI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/atomiccmpxchginst/#a1ac603480e5e3cf5e17c5e646aaebea1">getMergedOrdering</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1337"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1338"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In implementations which use a barrier to achieve release semantics, we can</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1339"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// delay emitting this barrier until we know a store is actually going to be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1340"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// attempted. The cost of this delay is that we need 2 copies of the block</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1341"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// emitting the load-linked, affecting code size.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1342"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1343"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Ideally, this logic would be unconditional except for the minsize check</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1344"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// since in other cases the extra blocks naturally collapse down to the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1345"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// minimal loop. Unfortunately, this puts too much stress on later</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1346"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// optimisations so we avoid emitting the extra logic in those cases too.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1347"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> HasReleasedLoadBB = !CI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/atomiccmpxchginst/#a91b66c93e687bd0ea2d74a896c09408b">isWeak</a>() &amp;&amp; ShouldInsertFencesForAtomic &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1348"><Highlight kind="normal">                           SuccessOrder != <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7a14194d0b2e6c6680067975517cd58eac">AtomicOrdering::Monotonic</a> &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1349"><Highlight kind="normal">                           SuccessOrder != <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7a993ca650a85e8e69b8f7eaa4809c4862">AtomicOrdering::Acquire</a> &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1350"><Highlight kind="normal">                           !<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>-&gt;hasMinSize();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1351"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1352"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There&#39;s no overhead for sinking the release barrier in a weak cmpxchg, so</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1353"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// do it even on minsize.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1354"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> UseUnconditionalReleaseBarrier = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>-&gt;hasMinSize() &amp;&amp; !CI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/atomiccmpxchginst/#a91b66c93e687bd0ea2d74a896c09408b">isWeak</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1355"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1356"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Given: cmpxchg some&#95;op iN&#42; %addr, iN %desired, iN %new success&#95;ord fail&#95;ord</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1357"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1358"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The full expansion we produce is:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1359"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     &#91;...&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1360"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %aligned.addr = ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1361"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// cmpxchg.start:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1362"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %unreleasedload = @load.linked(%aligned.addr)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1363"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %unreleasedload.extract = extract value from %unreleasedload</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1364"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %should&#95;store = icmp eq %unreleasedload.extract, %desired</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1365"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     br i1 %should&#95;store, label %cmpxchg.releasingstore,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1366"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                          label %cmpxchg.nostore</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1367"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// cmpxchg.releasingstore:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1368"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     fence?</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1369"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     br label cmpxchg.trystore</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1370"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// cmpxchg.trystore:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1371"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     %loaded.trystore = phi &#91;%unreleasedload, %cmpxchg.releasingstore&#93;,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01705" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1705"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01706" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1706"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In order to use one of the sized library calls such as</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01707" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1707"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#95;&#95;atomic&#95;fetch&#95;add&#95;4, the alignment must be sufficient, the size</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1710"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// function wouldn&#39;t actually be defined.)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1711" lineLink="#a6312845f74f9bb3101268e4598ae05a5"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a6312845f74f9bb3101268e4598ae05a5">canUseSizedAtomicCall</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1712"><Highlight kind="normal">                                  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1713"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: &quot;LargestSize&quot; is an approximation for &quot;largest type that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1714"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// you can express in C&quot;. It seems to be the case that int128 is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1715"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// supported on all 64-bit platforms, otherwise only up to 64-bit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1716"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// integers are supported. If we get this wrong, then we&#39;ll try to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1717"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// call a sized libcall that doesn&#39;t actually exist. There should</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01718" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1718"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// really be some more reliable way in LLVM of determining integer</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01719" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1719"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// sizes which are valid in the target&#39;s C ABI...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01720" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1720"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> LargestSize = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>.getLargestLegalIntTypeSizeInBits() &gt;= 64 ? 16 : 8;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01934" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1934"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This target does not implement the requested atomic libcall so give up.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01935" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1935"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1936"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1937"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01938" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1938"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Build up the function call. There&#39;s two kinds. First, the sized</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01939" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1939"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// variants.  These calls are going to be one of the following (with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01940" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1940"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// N=1,2,4,8,16):</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1941"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  iN    &#95;&#95;atomic&#95;load&#95;N(iN &#42;ptr, int ordering)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1942"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  void  &#95;&#95;atomic&#95;store&#95;N(iN &#42;ptr, iN val, int ordering)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1943"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  iN    &#95;&#95;atomic&#95;&#123;exchange|fetch&#95;&#42;&#125;&#95;N(iN &#42;ptr, iN val, int ordering)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1944"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  bool  &#95;&#95;atomic&#95;compare&#95;exchange&#95;N(iN &#42;ptr, iN &#42;expected, iN desired,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1945"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                                    int success&#95;order, int failure&#95;order)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1946"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1947"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that these functions can be used for non-integer atomic</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1948"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// operations, the values just need to be bitcast to integers on the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1949"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// way in and out.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1950"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1951"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// And, then, the generic variants. They look like the following:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01952" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1952"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  void  &#95;&#95;atomic&#95;load(size&#95;t size, void &#42;ptr, void &#42;ret, int ordering)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01953" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1953"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  void  &#95;&#95;atomic&#95;store(size&#95;t size, void &#42;ptr, void &#42;val, int ordering)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1954"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  void  &#95;&#95;atomic&#95;exchange(size&#95;t size, void &#42;ptr, void &#42;val, void &#42;ret,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1955"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                          int ordering)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1956"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  bool  &#95;&#95;atomic&#95;compare&#95;exchange(size&#95;t size, void &#42;ptr, void &#42;expected,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1957"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                                  void &#42;desired, int success&#95;order,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1958"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                                  int failure&#95;order)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1959"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1960"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The different signatures are built up depending on the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01961" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1961"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#39;UseSizedLibcall&#39;, &#39;CASExpected&#39;, &#39;ValueOperand&#39;, and &#39;HasResult&#39;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01962" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1962"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// variables.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
